availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mostison O. Hawthorne (Ballard County, Kentucky, physician.)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Son of William Hawthorn and Catherine Hawthorn. Married to Sarah Eveline Bodkin in Ballard County, Kentucky on December 10, 1857 Father of Charles Hawthorn and William Hawthorn. Physician in Ballard County, Kentucky in 1850. Physician in Ballard County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard, Blandville, p.277B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard, Picketts, p. 597.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard, District 5, p.439B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Ballard County Marriages, Film #000216816.
